pr_title: # Changed to java.util.concurrent Collections and removed unnecessary syncs.

timeline.message:
# Changed to java.util.concurrent Collections and removed unnecessary syncs.

Signed-off-by: immmus <fonto.trg@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: why change a specific import to a wildcard ?
timeline.author: wbittles

replies.bodyText: This idea was made automatically I just did not pay attention. But resole it is easily.
replies.author: immmus

replies.bodyText: Good spot @wbittles - certainly we should not use wildcards.
replies.author: planetf1

replies.bodyText: Yes, I will remove it . I am just on vocation now:)
replies.author: immmus

timeline.bodyText: If the intention of this change is to modernise the code, then should these calls to currentTimeMillis() not be replaced with the more modern time classes, especially as duration is used below
timeline.author: wbittles

replies.bodyText: In this case it has no meaning)
replies.author: immmus

timeline.bodyText:
If it's faster , do we still need this mapToCheck HashMap, it would be far more efficient not to actually make a copy.
It would be useful to understand any problem with locking the unprocessedEventQueues
timeline.author: wbittles

replies.bodyText: That's exactly that we don't need it, I deleted this code. And we also dont need this lock, in principle, when working atomic collections and therefore I removed it.
replies.author: immmus

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/odpi/egeria into immmus-kafka_connector_concurrency
